topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54cf386d636872015b8d0800#post_54cf386d636872015b8d0800
HeartCatch Precure.
Imagine the animation styles of Ojamajo Doremi, Saint Seiya, and Casshern Sins rolled into one Magical Girl anime.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
The facial proportions and general expressiveness of the characters' faces are more in line with Ojamajo Doremi but their body type, proportions, and motions seem to be more like Saint Seiya. These are two great tastes that by all rights shouldn't taste great together, but do.

EXCEPT in the ending sequence. Taking that style and trying to transition it to a 3D model just looks creepy.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
So against better judgement I've watched the latest episode of kantai. . .  Christ; they had interesting character development and then they pulled a bait and switch just to not make anyone angry that they killed off a character by retconning her as alive later.  I know it's a spoiler, but chances are nobody else watches it; one of the main characters dies, but nope turns out she's magically fine the next episode.

I have a feeling this is going to turn out why Dog Days is such garbage cause chances are it'll be a war anime where nobody gets injured.  The previous girls that were originally main characters have already been sidelined so chances are that girl will get immediately sidelined.

Kantai; please stop cycling through your "main" characters every episode cause if you have each character have a episode where they're considered a main character then how is anyone supposed to develop any attachment to them.

The girl showed up for less than ten minutes, "died" then somehow came back.  I hope they were paying that voice actress by the word cause she must have been pissed.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
